page.title: 08Home life in Leverton
page.content: Many people who live in the village still carry on the old customs of cockling,eating {samphire }and stuffed chine.The cockles are gathered from the outmarsh at low tide in sacks,brought home,boiled and either eaten straight away or pickled in vinegar.The{samphire }is also picked at low tide in the autumn on those parts of the outmarsh which are regularly covered by the tide as this is considered to be the best.It is washed,boiled and served with vinegar as a sort of poor man's asparagus.It is very much an acquired taste.Stuffed chine is also an autumn custom and dates from the times when people killed the family pig before winter.The chine is stuffed with parsley and boiled.It is eaten cold with ham and usually a good sprinkling of vinegar.
